channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Half a million Covid testing kits from Randox recalled 'after checks revealed they were not sterile'
item.description: The Department of Health yesterday instructed care homes and members of the public to immediately stop using the kits produced by Northern Irish manufacturer Randox Laboratories.

item.title: Girl, 13, rushed to hospital after she stood on a 5ft long weever fish while paddling on beach
item.description: Lottie Dawson, 13, stood on something sharp at the seaside in Sutton on Sea, Lincs, and her foot began to swell up and her toe turned black. Her family later found out she stood on a weever fish spine.

item.title: Fire strikes ride and workshop on Blackpool pier
item.description: The blaze started on the 152-year-old structure on the Lancashire coast at around 3am and required ten fire engines to bring it under control.

item.title: Incredible designs you didn't know you needed
item.description: Internet users across the globe have shared the incredible designs they have come across both in their everyday life, and on their travels - including a pizza box that doubles up as a tray.

item.title: Covid jobs carnage continues with London's Southbank Centre planning to shed TWO-THIRDS of staff
item.description: The Southbank, which is the biggest arts complex in Europe, warns that 400 of the 600 jobs at the centre in Waterloo are at risk. Pictured: Barriers and tape seal off the area outside the Southbank Centre.

item.title: Should've followed the recipe! Home bakers reveal their MOST disastrous cakes
item.description: Social media users from around the world took to Reddit to offer up photos of the creations, which come complete with drooping icing and dodgy sponge work.

item.title: Family lawyer admits UK CANNOT be sure Shamima Begum won't be a terror threat
item.description: Tasnime Akunjee also declared that a 'lack of technology' in the Syrian camp where Begum is living means she cannot fairly fight for her British passport to be returned.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Is YOUR town at risk of a local lockdown?
item.description: The map of England, which will be updated each week, paints a clear picture showing the Covid-19 crisis in cities, towns and even small villages being hit hard by the virus.

item.title: Putin 'almost certainly' knew about Covid hacking, says former intelligence chair
item.description: Lady Neville Jones told the BBC she is 'almost certain' that the Russian President will have been aware that his operatives launched cyber attacks on Oxford University and Imperial College London.

item.title: PM to unveil plan to get Britain back to near-normal after coronavirus crisis
item.description: In a major intervention tomorrow, the Prime Minister will set out his vision for reviving the economy while living with the menace of coronavirus.

item.title: Thrifty mum shows off £110 toilet transformation which she completed in just one day
item.description: DIY-enthusiast Loren Pearson, from Dudley, completely transformed her space for only £110 using bargain items from IKEA and The Range. It took only a day to finish the project.

item.title: Billy Joel goes viral for an impromptu street performance on a discarded wooden piano in Long Island
item.description: In recently caught cellphone footage, the singer could be heard playing a Ragtime-type tune on the sidewalk, after spotting the instrument sitting curbside.

item.title: Kate Middleton has relaxed into a 'mumsy' look of dressing down her designer frocks
item.description: Kate is known for causing sell-out trends across Britain, but despite following both designer and high street fashion, she notably steers away from following the more edgy styling .

item.title: Was tech millionaire murdered and dismembered by an employee? NYPD hunts person of interest
item.description: Police sources say the person of interest worked for the victim and their business deal apparently went bad. Cops are not releasing the name of the person, who is not yet in custody.

item.title: No10's new race chief is forced to apologise for his 'wrong and offensive' comments
item.description: The head of Downing Street's new racial disparity commission Tony Sewell has today been forced to apologise over comments he made regarding homosexual men.

item.title: Susie Burrell: The four diet mistakes you are making after 7pm
item.description: While a calorie deficit, a regular exercise routine and balanced meals will help you achieve your health and fitness goals, there are four evening diet mistakes that will undo your hard work.

item.title: Naga Munchetty slams troll who calls her 'that Asian bird who wears whatever the hell she wants'
item.description: Naga Munchetty publicly called out a pair of Twitter trolls on Thursday after they attacked her for what she was wearing on BBC Breakfast.

item.title: JAN MOIR: Just how DO lockdown lotharios find the time to cheat?
item.description: JAN MOIR: Major General Rupert Jones (pictured), the son of a Falklands War hero, was in charge of the UK military's response to the coronavirus pandemic abroad.
item.media:credit: Jamie Wiseman for The Daily Mail

item.title: Meghan 'won't take back her beloved rescue dog Bogart' because the pup 'doesn't like Harry'
item.description: Meghan was said to have been left devastated when when she was forced to leave Bogart in Toronto when she moved to the UK to live with Harry in 2017. She has two other dogs with her husband.

item.title: Taiwan introduces hoods to make executions 'more humane'
item.description: Taiwan has released new procedures for carrying out capital punishment - including preventing the condemned from seeing their executioner and allowing them to leave messages for loved ones.

item.title: MP Lloyd Russell-Moyle resigns from Labour front bench
item.description: The Brighton Kemptown and Peacehaven representative is the latest of former Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn's allies to depart the shadow cabinet.

item.title: Twitter is investigating whether hackers BRIBED an employee to get access to high-profile accounts
item.description: Wednesday's breach was among the largest ever on a social media site, affecting the accounts of former President Barack Obama, Joe Biden, and other well known figures on a massive scale.

item.title: Speedboat killer Jack Shepherd has 78 days cut from his 10 year jail term
item.description: Speedboat killer Jack Shepherd should leave prison sooner than expected as he served 78 days in custody awaiting extradition in Georgia, a Court of Appeal has ruled.

item.title: White passengers force black teenager off bus after row
item.description: Video footage recorded on public transport in Lewisham, south London shows two men telling a young black teenager to get off a bus and shouting abuse at him.

item.title: Donald Trump's niece Mary reveals she heard her uncle use the n-word and anti-Semitic slurs
item.description: Speaking to Rachel Maddow on MSNBC Mary Trump, main, said: 'Of course I did. And I don't think that should surprise anybody given how virulently racist he is today.' Trump is inset.

item.title: Police to stop demanding mobile phones from rape victims
item.description: A string of defendants had charges of rape and serious sexual assault against them dropped when critical material emerged as they went on trial.

item.title: Miss Swimsuit UK, 23, is stripped of her title after she posted 'All Lives Matter'
item.description: The 2019 swimsuit champion, Jasmine Archer-Jones, 23, from Chester, who moved to Texas shortly after winning the title, took to Facebook to share her view writing: 'ALL lives matter',

item.title: Duchess of Cornwall's birthday: Clarence House releases photo
item.description: Clarence House has released a picture of the Duchess of Cornwall to mark her 73rd birthday this Friday. Camilla is seen beaming as she poses from her Clarence House home.

item.title: Why Boris's back to work drive is doomed to failure
item.description: London's once-bustling business and finance district's largest companies have brought just 15 per cent of staff back to work. Cafes and bars say it has caused business to shrink by 80 per cent

item.title: Government accused of lack of transparency over Sunak's Plan for Jobs
item.description: The Institute for Fiscal Studies called for the Treasury to be more open about funding for its coronavirus economic response.
item.media:description: The IFS has said Rishi Sunak´s emergency Plan for Jobs to tackle the coronavirus crisis will involve up to £10bn less spending on previously planned projects (Stefan Rousseau/PA)

item.title: Former model whose face was slashed in an attack undergoes multiple cosmetic procedures
item.description: Marla Hanson, 59, was given a total transformation while appearing on Netflix's new makeover series Skin Decision: Before and After.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Leicester stays in lockdown apart from schools
item.description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock has announced that Leicester must remain in lockdown except for its schools and nurseries, which will be allowed to reopen.

item.title: Public Health England publish list of areas most at risk from lockdowns because of Covid-19 spikes
item.description: Areas such as Pendle, in Lancashire, Herefordshire, and East Staffordshire have all seen spikes in the number of coronavirus cases in the last fortnight, Public Health England has revealed.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: He's no plinth charming, says slaver statue artist Marc Quinn's ex love
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: He was painted a hero this week for creating a statue of the BLM protester, Jen Reid. But has provocative artist Marc Quinn, been hoist by his own petard?

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Why DO our judges put terror suspects' interests ahead of our safety?
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Once jihadi bride Shamima Begum sets foot on British soil again, what do you think the chances are of her ever being deported? Less than zero.

item.title: Princess Anne blasts Prince Charles's views on climate change
item.description: Enthusing about genetically modified crops and dismissing the effects of climate change and veganism couldn't be further away from the green views of Prince Charles.

item.title: Donald Trump turns the White House into a rally venue again by posing under a Trump-branded crane
item.description: President Donald Trump blasted regulations, and spoke at length about showers, dishwashers, and light bulbs at a campaign-style event at the White House where he attacked Joe Biden.

item.title: 'Now I Am Become Death' 75th Anniversary of 'Trinity,' the world's first nuclear bomb explosion
item.description: 75th anniversary of the world's first nuclear bomb explosion that was tested in New Mexico before it was dropped on Hiroshima three weeks later in 1945. Test director said, 'Now we are all sons of b***ches.'

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg criticizes Trump administration's handling of coronavirus
item.description: Speaking with Fauci on Thursday, Zuckerberg said some outbreaks were 'avoidable' and criticized the administration for 'calling into question' whether people should wear masks.

item.title: Benjamin Keough's father Danny is pictured after his son's suicide
item.description: Danny Keough, a former musician, was pictured outside the Beverly Hills Hotel in Los Angeles on Thursday with Benjamin's girlfriend Diana Pinto, four days after the suicide of his 27-year-old son.

item.title: Victoria is set to report more than 400 cases of coronavirus
item.description: Victoria is expected to report more than 400 cases of coronavirus in the past 24 hours.

item.title: Netflix promotes Ted Sarandos to co-CEO, announces 10.1million new subscribers during pandemic
item.description: Netflix Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos will be the company's new co-CEO, the company announced Thursday as it released its second quarter earnings report.
item.media:description: FILE - In this Sunday, May 6, 2018, file photo, Ted Sarandos attends the 2018 Netflix FYSee Kick-Off Event at Raleigh Studios Hollywood in Los Angeles. Netflix added a flood of new subscribers amid the coronavirus pandemic and also offered clues to a possible successor for founding CEO Reed Hastings, who on Thursday, July 16, 2020, named the company's chief content officer, Sarandos, as co-CEO. (Photo by Richard Shotwell/Invision/AP, File)

item.title: Phone company boss 'recorded claiming call records used in Rio Ferdinand's drugs test case paid for'
item.description: John Shepherd, who runs Sport Mobile, was recorded claiming that a secret payment of £20,000 was paid to a Vodafone employee for evidence key to an FA probe into Mr Ferdinand, say the Times.

item.title: Leaked documents on US-UK trade talks 'almost certainly' spread by Russian actors
item.description: In a statement tonight, the Russian embassy in London said it 'will never interfere' in internal affairs in the UK, following claims 'Russian actors amplified leaked US-UK trade deal documents' online.

item.title: Ex-RAF pilot, 80, crashes his hand built replica Nazi plane
item.description: Barry Conway, 80, flipped his home-built Focke Wulf aircraft when trying to land in Ogbourne St George in Wiltshire. Mr Conway suffered a a cracked vertebrae in his neck and back.

item.title: Struggling universities must tackle 'cancel culture' to be handed emergency loans
item.description: Education Secretary Gavin Williamson has made protecting free speech a condition of a new loan scheme aimed at helping higher education institutions through the pandemic.

item.title: Single radio producer, 34, reveals rising 'foster girlfriend' dating trend
item.description: A single Australian radio producer has discovered that she was a 'foster girlfriend' for many of her previous lovers, as she explains the new dating trend and how to identify it.

item.title: Cairns shark attack victim who was mauled while making documentary tells how she escaped
item.description: Anika Craney, 29, suffered significant leg injuries after she was bitten by the shark - believed to be a bronzed whaler - while swimming off Fitzroy Island near Cairns on Tuesday afternoon.

item.title: Fury at Jofra Archer for his flouting of Covid rules and the England star faces a ban
item.description: The 24-year-old faces a fine and possibly a suspension from an 'internal' disciplinary inquiry after breaking the strict rules surrounding England's Test series against West Indies.

item.title: End of the BA jumbo jets: British Airways scraps ENTIRE FLEET of iconic 747 planes
item.description: The nation's flag carrier is the world's last major operator of the iconic Boeing 747 'Queen of the Skies', which has been in service with the airline since 1971.

item.title: Florida dad is fighting for his life after contracting COVID-19 from his son
item.description: John Place, 42, from Plantation, Florida is currently in the intensive care unit at Westside Regional Medical Center where he was put on a ventilator for more than two weeks.

item.title: Chris Watts's prison cell full of photos of family he murdered
item.description: Chris Watts is serving three life sentences for the July 2018 killings of his pregnant wife Shanann, 34, and their two daughters.

item.title: TOM UTLEY on ordering a pint with an app
item.description: TOM UTLEY Some may feel that 4.15pm is a little early in the day to kick off an evening's drinking.

item.title: Tory rebels turn their sights on plan for Chinese-designed nuclear power station
item.description: The flashpoint will be a new power plant in Bradwell, Essex, which under current plans is to be designed by China General Nuclear Power Corporation.

item.title: Merck CEO says raising COVID-19 vaccine hopes is a 'grave disservice'
item.description: COVID-19 vaccines under development are not guaranteed to work and people who say to expect a vaccine before year-end are doing a 'grave disservice,' warned Merck CEO Kenneth Frazier.

item.title: Number of gambling addicts who feel suicidal has quadrupled during coronavirus lockdown
item.description: The charity has also seen a five-fold increase in the number of referrals for treatment to severe gambling addiction it receives from the NHS and other groups.

item.title: Gordon Ramsay 'is set to by endure MONTHS of loud construction work from Cornish neighbours'
item.description: Gordon Ramsay 'is set to by endure MONTHS of loud construction work from Cornish neighbours'

item.title: Instagram will launc rival to TikTok called Reels which will go live across the globe next month
item.description: Sources familiar with the matter say the social media giant roll out the feature, called Reels, to 50 countries across the world. TechCrunch confirmed that Reels will be available in the US next month.

item.title: Contact tracing cannot reduce transmission of Covid-19 if a person is not tested within three days
item.description: Researchers from the University of Utrecht in the Netherlands said the reproduction R rate can be kept under one as long as only two in 10 patients slip under the radar.

item.title: Human case of the PLAGUE is confirmed in Colorado for the first time in 5 years
item.description: For the first time in five years, Colorado confirmed a human case of the plague as they issued a public health warning of an 'increase of reported plague activity' in animals in the state.

item.title: Record number of patients are being treated in hospital for obesity
item.description: NHS figures for England show there were 876,000 admissions last year linked to obesity, with women making up two in three patients.

item.title: Eleven rare peregrine falcon chicks hatch at National Trust sites
item.description: Three peregrine chicks have been reared at the 12th century Corfe Castle in Dorset, while another eight chicks are being cared for at National Trust sites in the Peak District.

item.title: First crop of blackcurrants bred to cope with warmer winters due to climate change bears fruit
item.description: Some 75,000 bushes of the new variety of blackcurrant, named Ben Lawers, are fruiting for the first time this year after 20 years of research, scientists said.

item.title: Shamima Begum did seem convincingly disenchanted by her experiences, writes RICHARD PENDLEBURY
item.description: RICHARD PENDLEBURY: My view remains that she should be allowed back to face justice here. Yesterday the Court of Appeal agreed but Shamima's journey is far from over.

item.title: Virginia Roberts: Ghislaine Maxwell 'worse' than Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: Jeffrey Epstein's former 'sex slave' Virginia Roberts Giuffre has claimed Ghislaine Maxwell was 'worse' than the billionaire pedophile and was the 'mastermind' behind his sex trafficking scheme.

item.title: Brother of murdered Stephen Lawrence slams Boris Johnson for having 'extreme' views
item.description: Speaking as part of an ITV panel discussing racism in the UK since the death of his brother, Stuart Lawrence said the fight against racism was not over.

item.title: Before-and-after photos via Amos Chapple show how Budapest has been rebuilt after WWII devastation
item.description: These remarkable before-and-after pictures show that the city was left in ruins - and then rebuilt into one of the jewels of Eastern Europe.

item.title: Average person has over 6,000 thoughts per day, according to study that isolated a 'thought worm'
item.description: Experts have isolated a 'worm thought' in the human brain, allowing them to see when an idea begins and ends. The method reveals that the average person has over 6,000 thoughts in a day.

item.title: Men who watch too much porn are more likely to suffer erectile dysfunction, study shows
item.description: A study assessed porn habits of men in Denmark and Belgium and compared this with their sexual habits.

item.title: Children witnesses fireball horror as bus and bike collide
item.description: The incident happened outside the Blue Dolphin holiday park near Filey, north Yorkshire around 5pm. Witnesses said both vehicles were engulfed in flames within seconds of the impact.

item.title: Britons reveal the top 30 things they love most about staycations and it's coastal walks that's No1
item.description: A poll asked UK adults what their favourite things about holidaying closer to home are, with sightseeing fourth and visiting the seaside fifth. Buying a stick of rock failed to make the top 30.

item.title: Iranian spies accidentally leaked videos of themselves hacking showing stealing from email accounts
item.description: Hackers working for one of the most active Iranian government-sponsored hacking groups, APT35 or Charming Kitten, have been filmed accessing email accounts and trawling data.

item.title: Prince Charles plants tree at socially-distanced RAF graduation
item.description: Decked out in number one RAF full ceremonial dress, Prince Charles, 71, told graduates in Lincolnshire that he was 'immensely impressed' with them for continuing their training during the Covid-19 crisis.

item.title: Baroness Emma Nicholson launches a passionate defence of free speech
item.description: FRANCES HARDY: Although Lady Nicholson apologised 'unreservedly' for the unintended slur, she found herself accused of racism, transphobia and homophobia.

item.title: So which sister at war do YOU blame? One was a jet-setting TV producer, the other lived penniless
item.description: For years they wished each other dead and had no contact at all. Now author Tess Stimson and her estranged sister Philippa reveal how a toxic five-year family rift has ended in reconciliation.

item.title: Red Bull exec criticized for BLM response shared 'racist' map
item.description: Red Bull has fired three of its senior executives amid a row over company culture. Florian Klaass in February used a racist map in a slideshow, while Stefan Kozak and Amy Taylor spoke out.

item.title: Fresh questions over BBC impartiality after reporter called for 'clown' Boris Johnson to be sacked
item.description: Community Affairs Correspondent Rianna Croxford, who has worked there since 2018, made the remarks on Twitter the previous year.

item.title: Sue Perkins reveals the VERY embarrassing injury she suffered after falling off a ladder
item.description: British presenter Sue Perkins has contributed to doctor-turned-comedy writer Adam Kay's new book. He has compiled more than 100 stories in which celebrities pay tribute to the NHS.

item.title: Former Bishop of Edinburgh reveals why he is moving back to the Church after becoming agnostic
item.description: Richard Holloway, former Bishop of Edinburgh who became agnostic, is taking a step towards what he calls (his subtitle) Making Meaning In A Meaningless Universe in his book Stories We Tell Ourselves.

item.title: Disgraced British doctor is leading movement against covid vaccine
item.description: Speaking in the measured, authoritative tones of an expert, Andrew Wakefield delivered his considered judgment on the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: The secret love Beethoven took to his grave
item.description: Beethoven: A Life in Nine Pieces by Laura Tunbridge, a professor of music at Oxford, sees the author take nine pieces of music and use each one to illustrate a key theme of Beethoven's life.

item.title: Jake Paul under fire for throwing massive party at Calabasas mansion despite pandemic
item.description: YouTuber Jake Paul, 23, threw a massive party at his Calabasas, California mansion on Saturday despite concerns surrounding the pandemic.

item.title: So what gives women the edge? It's the X-factor!
item.description: American scientist Sharon Moalem's thesis in his book The Better Half is simple: that because of their chromosomes, women are genetically superior to men.

item.title: ANDREW PIERCE examines the extraordinary spat between Julian Lewis and Boris Johnson
item.description: ANDREW PIERCE: But the ex-minister, to whose political career the word 'hapless' has been attached, failed to notice a half-smile fellow Tory MP Julian Lewis's face.

item.title: Mother, 38, is rushed to hospital after being poisoned by courgettes she grew in lockdown
item.description: Danielle Baxter, 38, from Southend, Essex, became ill hours after eating the Unwins seeds. Westland, which owns the British seed company, halted sales of the product last night after the incident.

item.title: Scientists compare bones of Middle Ages nobles and commoners
item.description: Experts collected samples from 69 dead nobles and commoners from the Middle Ages in search of differences in the remains. The results showed different levels of certain elements due to diet.

item.title: Dragonfly devours a horsefly in driver's video of car window
item.description: Destiny Cooper filmed a dragonfly slowly devouring a horsefly as she sat in her car in Maurepas, Louisiana. She is heard gasping in horror and saying 'I'm disgusted' as she watches the scene.

item.title: Kanye pays $35,000 to qualify for November election ballot
item.description: Kanye West will make it on the presidential ballot in deep-red Oklahoma as of Wednesday after spending enough money in campaign activity to qualify for the election in November.

item.title: Blue Whale Challenge: Warning over 'game' encouraging suicide
item.description: Northants Police today issued a warning on social media about the game that allegedly originated in Russia in 2016 and is linked to numerous deaths.

item.title: Britain faces Credit Crunch II: Banks set to pull back from lending
item.description: Experts fear the UK could be heading for another credit crunch, as lenders are becoming more reluctant to get money out of the door despite demand from households and businesses.

item.title: Men, 19 and 24, arrested after man, 27, shot dead in London
item.description: The 27-year-old victim was found by armed officers on Windrush Road, Harlesden, north west London at 3am after receiving reports of gunshots in the area.

item.title: Martin Lewis says ONE MILLION families are failing to claim £3,000-worth of pension credits
item.description: Writing in this week's MoneySavingExpert email, Martin Lewis, 48, from London, urged eligible British retirees to apply for pension credits before free TV licences for over-75s are axed next month.

item.title: Poll finds majority of Britons believe racism is rife
item.description: Nearly two-thirds of the population think there is a 'fair amount' or 'great deal' of racism in the UK, according to the study carried out by Number Cruncher Politics.

item.title: Colorado drone swarm flew in formation around 'mother ship'
item.description: A drone swam over Colorado and Nebraska in December and January remains a mystery, as government documents show that officials were left baffled by up to 50 drones flying in formation.

item.title: Nearly 250 buildings in England still have flammable cladding
item.description: Government figures found a total of 246 high-rise buildings still have aluminium composite material cladding on them, more than three years after the tower block blaze which killed 72 people.

item.title: Apple patent suggests AR glasses controlled by user's blinks
item.description: As noted by 9to5Mac, the application describes using eye-tracking technology to operate the device using different 'gestures' like blinks, stares, and other eye movements.

item.title: Julian Lewis accuses PM of 'improper' bid to seize control of security watchdog
item.description: Julian Lewis hit out after No10 ejected him from the Tory party in revenge for his dramatic ambush of Chris Grayling last night, which saw him installed as chair of the Intelligence and Security Committee.

item.title: Gruesome-looking 'Darth Vader' sea cockroach found in the Indian Ocean identified as new species
item.description: Researchers from Singapore found the frightful creature during a deep-sea survey off of the coast of Banten, Western Java, Indonesia back in 2018.

item.title: Dad of Ghislaine Maxwell's lover doesn't know if they're married
item.description: Chris Borgerson said he was unaware of any marriage between his son Scott and Ghislaine Maxwell, expressing surprise and disbelief when approached at his Missouri home.

item.title: Men should limit alcohol to one drink a day, experts say
item.description: For 30 years, American men have been warned to limit their drinks to two a day, while women should keep it to one. But that's being scrapped in light of evidence that shows it increases risk of death.

item.title: Spain's tourists resorts lie EMPTY as only a trickle of tourists arrive and Magaluf SHUTS DOWN bars
item.description: The usually crowded beaches are eerily quiet in Spain's tourist destinations, Madrid's designer shops remain deserted and Seville is a ghost town as tourists refuse to travel.

item.title: Megan Thee Stallion seen bleeding on sidewalk after being shot
item.description: In the vision, police are seen ordering the music sensation, 25, to get out of an SUV driven by her friend, fellow rapper Tory Lanez, in the Hollywood Hills.

item.title: Gravestone to Dambuster hero's beloved black Labrador 'N*****' REPLACED by the RAF after review
item.description: The stone tablet, which is based at RAF Scampton in Lincolnshire, honoured Guy Gibson's black Labrador, which was run over by a car and killed on the day of the famous raid.

item.title: Family hold their nerve as hungry bear pulls down window screen and tries to break into their home
item.description: Christian Pondella came face-to-face with a bear as it tried to break into his home in Mammoth Lakes, California on July 1. In footage of the moment, he tells the hungry animal to 'get away'.

item.title: Boy, 5, 'gang-raped on Australian beach by four boys under 13'
item.description: The attack unfolded at Napranum, on the north-west coast of Cape York in Queensland on July 1, police allege.

item.title: Coronavirus outcome in the UK has not been good, Sir Patrick Vallance admits
item.description: Sir Patrick Vallance said the UK is 'still at a time when distancing measures are important' and that working remotely 'remains a perfectly good option'.

item.title: Chris Evans to send boy Captain America shield after heroically saving his sister from dog attack
item.description: Avengers star Chris Evans has honored a little boy who saved his sister from being ravaged by a charging dog, sending him a sweet video message and vowing to send him a Captain America shield.

item.title: The ultimate guide to wearing a face mask in comfort
item.description: FEMAIL's guide comes after people have taken to social media to complain of bad skin, smudged make-up and fogged up glasses as a result of wearing a face mask to stop the spread of Covid.

item.title: 100k drivers could get fine refunds due to 'inadequate' signs
item.description: After a three-year review, the Traffic Penalty Tribunal (TPT) has made a ruling in the case of Newcastle's John Dobson Street, where almost 92,000 drivers were fined in 16 months.

item.title: CCTV shows Johnny Depp in 'extremely agitated' state in lift
item.description: The actor was seen rocking back and forth in the lift in the Eastern Columbia Building in CCTV footage taken on May 21, 2016 and shown to London's High Court as part of Depp's libel case.

item.title: Mother, 51, works out 20 times a week to outdo her 20s body
item.description: Lynn Montoya, from Southern California, is a fitness trainer who specializes in transforming the figures of middle-aged women.

item.title: Plaid Cymru suspend Welsh MP after caution for attack on wife
item.description: Plaid Cymru's disciplinary panel suspended Jonathan Edwards, MP for Carmarthen East, from the party for 12 months after ten years in the House of Commons.

item.title: Johnny Depp's exes Winona Ryder and Vanessa Paradis blast 'horrific' claims against him
item.description: Johnny Depp, 57, is suing The Sun publisher over an April 2018 article which alleged he was violent towards ex-wife Amber Heard, 34, during their tumultuous relationship.

item.title: Norland Nanny reveals the easy ways to discipline your childd
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Louenna Hood, 36, from Suffolk, graduated from Norland College, the world's most elite nanny school, 15 years ago and since worked with many high-profile families.

item.title: You CAN go on a cruise - but on a river: Government says trips will be allowed on smaller waterways
item.description: FCO guidance previously stated that it 'advises against cruise ship travel at this time' but a lack of clarity left many wondering what exactly this meant and which type of cruises, if any, were allowed.

item.title: 'Accidental selfie' of missing Ely man, 59, sent to family iPad
item.description: Husband and father Stephen Ridley (pictured) has not been seen since Monday, sparking a police appeal for information. His family say he was feeling depressed by coronavirus before his disappearance.

item.title: Morrisons is set to take on trendy meal kits such as Hello Fresh with a family recipe box
item.description: Priced at £30, which includes next-day or nominated day delivery, the Morrisons family recipe box, which is available across the UK, works out at just £1.50 per meal per head.

item.title: Scientists find new evidence of land-splitting tsunami 8,150 years ago off England's coast
item.description: Analysis of underwater deposits taken from the North Sea, just off the coast of Lincolnshire, show trademarks of a tsunami event.

item.title: Coronavirus Wales: Public transport mobile phone chats BANNED
item.description: The Welsh governments directive also ordered passengers not to run for the bus, or run in major transport hubs such as railway stations. Operators could bring them into force from July 13.

item.title: Charlie Elphicke 'agreed to pay £5k to accuser for kiss'
item.description: Elphicke, who was Dover MP from 2010 until 2019 when he was succeeded by his wife Natalie Elphicke, denies three counts of sexual assault in 2007 and 2016.

item.title: Gas-spraying attacker leaves 14 Selfridges staff and shoppers needing treatment
item.description: Nine shoppers were treated on Oxford Street, London for effects of the spray, which Metropolitan Police said was similar to the riot control agent CS gas.

item.title: First UK holidaymakers arrive at Athens airport
item.description: A Tui flight departed from Gatwick yesterday morning to Rhodes, and people have been photographed arriving at Spata, east of Athens, this afternoon.

item.title: British built ESA Solar Orbiter captures the 'closest ever pictures' of the Sun
item.description: The stunning images taken by the Solar Orbiter while 47 million miles away from the surface of our host star include signs of mini solar flares called 'campfires'.

item.title: Britain announces 20 more coronavirus deaths in preliminary toll
item.description: Department of Health chiefs say 72 Britons are now succumbing to the life-threatening infection each day amid claims the government's official count of new fatalities is too high.

item.title: Mercury could hit 85F from Friday making Britain hotter than IBIZA
item.description: Though the week may have started downcast and gloomy for many, Brits can look forward to the weekend as the sun makes a welcome return on Friday.

item.title: Christian Brueckner goes to EU court to demand to be freed from jail on technicality over rape
item.description: Christian Brueckner's lawyer Friedrich Fulscher appeared before a panel of judges at the European Court of Justice in Luxembourg on Thursday.

item.title: German man on run who disarmed police left Rambo 'manifesto'
item.description: The manifesto, titled 'The Call of the Wild', is thought to have been written by Yves Etienne Rausch, 31, who has gone on the run in Germany's Black Forest.

item.title: Johnny Depp's bruised face is seen in photo shown to High Court
item.description: Johnny Depp's security guard Sean Bett today revealed four photographs of the actor with injuries after his then-wife Amber Heard allegedly attacked him, to support his sensational libel claim.

item.title: Vatican releases guidelines for bishops on how to handle clerical child abuse claims
item.description: The Vatican's long-awaited manual for bishops and religious superiors details how to conduct in-house investigations into allegations of priests who rape and molest minors and vulnerable adults.

item.title: Daily death toll 'is being INFLATED and fewer than 40 people are dying per day in the UK'
item.description: Dr Jason Oke and Professor Carl Heneghan at Oxford University's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine said PHE's death counts 'vary substantially from day to day'.

item.title: Private sector pay slump while public sector employees see incomes surge
item.description: The stark divide between the fortunes of the public and private sectors during coronavirus was underlined by new figures today.

item.title: Eating too much red meat could SPEED UP the ageing process
item.description: Researchers from Scotland and Germany analysed the genetic data of more than one million people to determine why some people's bodies age at different rates.

item.title: NS&I now aims for £35bn of savers' cash this financial year
item.description: The Treasury-backed bank now has a number of best buy savings deal and says the move has been made to 'reflect government finance requirements arising from Covid-19.'

item.title: British ISIS bride lost an arm and a breast in Syria bombing
item.description: Samia Hussein, a 25-year-old from Southall, west London, blamed ISIS for the loss of her arm. She said the caliphate put women and children at risk by storing supplies next to houses filled with families.

item.title: Jihadis jailed in the Middle East 'should be allowed BACK to their homelands', says report
item.description: A paper backed by ex-FBI agent Ali Soufan is urging Western nations including Britain to 'reconsider their stance on repatriation and bring home their citizens' jailed in Syria, Iraq and Turkey.

item.title: Priti Patel to mount a crackdown on foreign criminals after loopholes let 2,000 dodge deportation
item.description: The number of serious offenders deported from Britain has dropped by almost 40 per cent in the past four years with Home Secretary Priti Patel (inset) ready to mount crackdown on foreign criminals.
